alert.note: Alert for Cameron Island; Kenedy Island; Willacy Island (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued August 23 at 4:12AM CDT until August 23 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Kenedy Island, Willacy Island and Cameron Island. * WHEN...Until 1 PM CDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Large long period swells which originated from Tropical Storm Harold will continue to affect the coastline through this morning. Swells were steadily falling, and ocean waves had fallen below 5 feet with swell period at 6 to 7 seconds and the buoy 200 miles east of South Padre Island as of 4 AM. Swells will continue to subside this morning, and the rip current intensity will decrease as well. Still, even moderate risk levels can be dangerous for unaware swimmers.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Cameron Island; Kenedy Island; Willacy Island
